item.title: One Dollar Too Many
item.description: One Dollar Too Many is a 1968 Spaghetti Western feature film directed by Enzo G. Castellari and starring Antonio Sabàto, John Saxon, and Frank Wolff.

item.title: Dead Men Don't Count
item.description: Dead Men Don't Count is a 1968 Spanish-Italian Spaghetti Western film written and directed by Rafael Romero Marchent.

item.title: Clint the Stranger
item.description: Clint the Stranger, also known as Clint the Nevada's Loner, Nevada Clint and Clint, the Lonely Nevadan, is a 1967 Italian spaghetti western starring George Martin. A sequel entitled The Return of Clint the Stranger would follow in 1972.

item.title: Sundance and the Kid
item.description: Sundance and the Kid is the American release title of Vivi o, preferibilmente, morti, a 1969 Spaghetti Western comedy directed by Duccio Tessari and starring Giuliano Gemma, Nino Benvenuti, and Sydne Rome. The film is also known as Alive or Preferably Dead and Sundance Cassidy and Butch the Kid.

item.title: A Coffin for the Sheriff
item.description: A Coffin for the Sheriff is a 1965 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Mario Caiano and starring Anthony Steffen, Eduardo Fajardo, Fulvia Franco, George Rigaud and Armando Calvo.

item.title: God Forgives... I Don't!
item.description: God Forgives... I Don't! is a 1967 Spaghetti Western film directed and written by Giuseppe Colizzi. The film is the first in a trilogy followed by Ace High and ended with Boot Hill.

item.title: The Bounty Killer
item.description: The Ugly Ones is a 1966 Spanish-Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Eugenio Martín.

item.title: China 9, Liberty 37
item.description: China 9, Liberty 37 is an Italian-Spanish 1978 Western film directed by Monte Hellman, starring Warren Oates, Jenny Agutter, and Fabio Testi. Noted director Sam Peckinpah has a small, rare acting role. The film was shot in locations in Spain and Italy by cinematographer Giuseppe Rotunno. Pino Donaggio composed the musical score. The film had a very sparse theatrical release in the United States, and did not play in some cities until as late as 1984.

item.title: Between God
item.description: Between God, the Devil and a Winchester is a 1968 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Marino Girolami. The story is based on Treasure island by Robert Louis Stevenson..
